TopicTitle: Contract Filter 1.5.2(1.1.2) Manage the contracts you receive to your liking!

Articles.Content: Is it me or is the reject type missing?
@Tontow, it's you. You can most definitely reject contract types.
That's odd, when I click the individual types the window is blank and I have no reject by type option.
@Tontow, That sounds like a nullref of sorts to me, Give me your mod list and the output log

 I was using rejector, but I removed it and I still have an issue.
@Tontow, I am not seeing anything regarding my mod in your output log. Try uninstalling then re-installing fresh
too late, did that, from kerbalstuff, didn't work.
@Tontow, I have no idea what's wrong on your end. Try saving and loading on the main menu of CF
![870F42F9661A4F0E9A1BE39E54C717C7D36ED70E](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/716415632477777009/870F42F9661A4F0E9A1BE39E54C717C7D36ED70E/)
Is this working for everyone else?
@Tontow, have the debug menu open at the same time and see if there's any nullrefs. I also suggest you delete your settings.cfg and then re-run ksp again

Wow, that is allot of red.

[Exception]: DirectoryNotFoundException: Directory 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP\_Data\..\GameData\ContractFilter' not found.

The folder I dragged into my game data folder was named "ContractFilter1.2"

I looked inside of it just now I and see a gamedata folder and inside that, the ContractFilter folder. I removed the extra folders that you had packed in the zip........

And it is now working. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Ok, this is very nice: It is showing up when I have the contracts window open! (Mission Control)

Would it be possible to make it toggle accepting/rejecting a contract type when I right click on it? Instead of clicking on it and then reject? (one less mouse click to start rejecting or accepting a contract type.)
@Tontow That can't work for a few reasons, one because of the special way I open up the type editing windows, and two because the code doesn't differentiate between left click and right click.

It may be processing a bit fast or something else may be happening. I keep seeing a bug where contracts don't get an accept or reject button.

However, closing and reopening the contract window seems to fix it.

I seem to have broken the string blacklist filter for survey contracts. I tried adding "in flight above" and that didn't decline, so I changed it to "above" and still nothing.

And how would you go about rejecting a contract type unless a single condition is found? (If I find X condition in this contract type, then do not reject.)
@Tontow, I don't have conditionals in. I don't know if I'll make them a thing though.
Updated! Upgrade to the latest version for awesome new features and fixes!
Would it be possible to include in the GUI a button to revert all parameters set to Default?
@Poodmun, I'll add that in for the next release, I do not know when that is as there aren't many more features that need to be implemented.
The close button on the edit all windows is bust.
Hey guys, I have a question. What kind of contract type is "recover amount X of ore and deliver it to Y"? Because it seems i cant get the Filter to keep those in the loop...
@Black Dog, Those would probably be ISRU contracts

Thank you. For some reason my 'Explore Body' contracts were getting rejected and I couldn't see why so I ended up downloading the mod again and overwriting the settings.cfg to get back to Default behavior. Just thought it would be one of those 'Quality of Life" additions as its not a bug or game breaking.
@Poodmund, you can simply delete the settings.cfg and restart ksp, if it can't find the settings.cfg, it will rewrite with defaults
